Award.AwardTitle: MARGINS: Collaborative Research: Synthesis and Integration of Magmagenetic Controls for Subduction Factory Focus Sites
Award.AbstractNarration: "This award is funded under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009<br/>(Public Law 111-5)."<br/>Collaborative Research: Synthesis and Integration of Magmagenetic Controls for<br/>Subduction Factory focus sites<br/>Intellectual Merit: The MARGINS program ends in 2009, and the organization,<br/>synthesis, and integration of the most important results is a high priority for each of the<br/>four experiments. This proposal outlines a 3-year collaborative effort (between 5 US and<br/>2 Japanese scientists) to do this for key aspects of the Subduction Factory experiment.<br/>In co-operation with the LDEO database group, geochemical and isotopic data for fresh,<br/>young igneous rocks from the Izu-Bonin-Mariana and Central America Subduction<br/>Factory focus sites will be compiled and filtered to generate a Subduction Factory<br/>Geochemical Reference Library of high-quality data for each arc system. Forward<br/>models to explain the most important differences between the chemical and isotopic<br/>compositions of lavas erupted from the volcanic front and rear-arc volcanoes at the two<br/>focus sites will be generated and tested against compositions in this Library. Models will<br/>be site-specific, using all available geophysical observations to generate thermal<br/>structure and melt distribution models appropriate for each focus site. Best estimates for<br/>the compositions of subducted sediments and oceanic crust at each focus site will be<br/>used as input to thermodynamic models simulating equilibrium metamorphic reactions,<br/>dehydration, and melting of subducted sediments and oceanic crust (slab) within the<br/>subduction zone. Interaction of these slab fluids and melts with overlying mantle<br/>peridotite to yield primitive basalt will be modeled using the "Arc Basalt Simulator"<br/>(ABS), an Excel macro that explicitly separates key forcing functions and is designed to<br/>be flexible and accessible. Several improvements to ABS will also be accomplished<br/>during this project.<br/>Broader Impacts: This project is in response to calls for synthesis and integration efforts<br/>by the 2004 MARGINS Review Committee. Dissemination of results and training Earth<br/>scientists to use ABS will be accomplished at two free workshops at national scientific<br/>meetings. A lesson plan that uses ABS and the Subduction Factory Geochemical<br/>Library to explore the most important controls on subduction-zone magma genesis will<br/>be developed; this will be aimed at upper division Geoscience majors and beginning<br/>graduate students. Broader dissemination of the most important results to the general<br/>public will be accomplished via development of a Wikipedia entry for "Subduction<br/>Factory".<br/>NATIONAL SCIENCE FOUNDATION<br/>Proposal Abstract<br/>Proposal:0840794 PI Name:Stern, Robert<br/>Printed
